planning_sequence: human_action(Assess the overall condition of the structure to identify any signs of wear, damage, or other conditions that could affect stability during disassembly)
human_action(Clear the area around the structure of any unnecessary personnel, equipment, or debris to create a safe working environment)
human_action(Equip all personnel involved in the disassembly process with appropriate safety gear, including hard hats, safety glasses, gloves, and steel-toed boots)
human_action(Remove any non-structural elements or additional attachments from the structure to simplify the disassembly process and reduce weight)
human_action(Identify and label the five main elements of the structure: two upright columns, two horizontal beams (rafters), and one horizontal beam (either a base beam or ridge beam))
human_action(If the structure has a ridge beam, plan to remove it first. If no ridge beam is present, identify the rafter that appears to be under the least amount of stress for initial removal)
human_action(Continuously monitor the upright columns for any signs of movement or instability as the rafters are removed)
human_action(Once both rafters are removed, assess the stability of the upright columns again. If they are stable, plan to remove them next)
human_action(With one column removed, the remaining column may become more unstable. Ensure that it is braced or supported adequately before proceeding)
human_action(If a base beam is present and was providing lateral stability, it should be the last element to be removed)
human_action(Before removing the base beam, ensure that no other components or surrounding structures are relying on it for stability)
human_action(Label and organize all removed elements and hardware for future reassembly or storage)
human_action(Conduct a final cleanup of the area to ensure that all debris is removed and the site is safe)
human_action(Review the disassembly process to identify any issues or lessons learned that can be applied to future tasks)
